titleStmt.title: Sterling P. White v. Territory of Washington. Arrest Warrant

bibl.title: Territory of Washington V. Sterling P. White. Arrest Warrant
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Spokane County Government; Clerk, Territorial Case Files, 1879-1889

div1.p: United States of America Territory of Washington} To any sheriff or constable of the county. An inquisition having then this day found by the coroner's jury now stating that A.L. Beardon came to his death by the act of S. White alias Bud White by criminal means you are therefore commanded in the name of the United States of America forthwith to arrest the above names S. White alias Bud White and take him before the nearest of most accessible magistrate in this county. Given under my hand this 25th day of December AD 1884 J.W. Carpenter Justice of the Peace Acting Coroner of Lincoln County

Warrant Arrested the within named S. White and found that he was unable to be taken to a place of confinement from wound received place a guard over him by the order of JW Carpenter JP J. H. Friedlander Deputy Sheriff Lincoln Co. W.T. Dec 25th 1884 Filed March 5th 1885 Kate W. Feuerbach Clerk
